message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.PL

This paper discusses the security of OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect, which are commonly used in web applications. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a new technique to mitigate CSRF attacks, which involves software engineering and system implementation, making cs.SE (Software Engineering) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) also likely sub-categories. The paper may also fall under cs.CY (Computers and Society) as it discusses the security of widely used online services. Finally, cs.PL (Programming Languages) is a possible sub-category as the paper proposes a new technique to mitigate CSRF attacks, which may involve programming language design and implementation.
